text:
He is the rubber
He is also de boa
The Rubber Boa.

author: Adam Zittel
text:
The rubber boa
Swirling shapes, no end, no start
Made of pure outdoors

author: Adam Zittel
text:
A rubber boa
Has kids with a rattlesnake
A safe baby toy

author: Adam Zittel
text:
The rubber boa
Not the smartest of creatures
More brains than Leo

author: Adam Zittel
text:
Big rubber boa
Found him, he's in the basement
Caught mice, more than cats!

author: Mike Mumford
text:
The rubber boa
deadly to all the others
it is all alone.

author: Adam Zittel
text:
It doesn't know of
the ozone layer dying
it only knows life

author: Sean Barney
text:
The boa is cool
It is very rubbery
It can stretch a lot

author: Parwaiz Razban
text:
Cute little boa.
Don't be skurd, blud it's rubber.
It is so stretchable.

author: Max West
text:
My muscles are big.
I can move mountains with ease.
What is a deer mouse?

author: Adam Zittel
text:
Look beyond the snake
And into its slithering
Snakey way of life

author: Parwaiz Razban
text:
Those who observe him
Can never understand him
For he is alone.

author: Parwaiz Razban
text:
Immortality.
That is what we desire.
The boa has it.

author: Adam Zittel
text:
Why do we chase him?
Why do we disturb his peace?
He is scared of us.

author: Adam Zittel
text:
Slither through the woods
Without venom, he's helpless
And is forced to run

author: Robert Harper
text:
The Rubber Boa
It really likes to eat ducks
All 8 days a week

author: Marc Goeller
text:
The Rubber Boa
Long and squishy and round like
in my dirty hands

author: Matt Gallacher
text:
Beware the boa
That is very long and thin
Just look for rubber

author: Adam Zittel
text:
Small, scaled, and skinny
Slithering along his way
peaceful and happy

author: Josh Kean
text:
It might be stretchy
The rubber boa is pink
Rubber is pinkish

author: Adam Zittel
text:
The rubber boa
Hides from the people around
Who try to stretch him

author: Adam Zittel
text:
Why is he afraid
They ask, oblivious to
the harm they do him.

author: Sean Barney
text:
a rubber boa
is at our eco con lodge
behind a glass case

author: Sean Barney
text:
The rubber boa
is slithery to the touch
and is smooth as silk

author: Sean Barney
text:
Eternally blessed
by the hot rays of the sun
For warmth and Glory

author: Dr. Joey Hansen III
text:
The deer mouse runs fast
It runs from the rattlesnake
But not fast enough

author: Adam Zittel
text:
The scared little snake
Hides from the giants that chase
to imprison him.

author: Adam Zittel
text:
Slithering being
How can someone be so low
and yet so high?

author: Parwaiz Razban
text:
The Eternal One
Awesome in its rubberness
The Mighty Boa

author: Mark Davidson
text:
A bird trapped flightless
Rubber boa motionless
we are like them both.

author: Scott Jorgensen
text:
Deer mouse, poor deer mouse
inside of snake's gastric juice
later, is snake poop

author: Parwaiz Razban
text:
Through the lonely woods
Slithers the ageless boa
His time is nothing.

author: Ian Balcewski
text:
Pincers grasping stars,
tail poised for a deadly strike
King of the night sky
